DOC.brief_summary: Background : Non-specific shoulder pain high prevalence old adult provoke functional alteration . Besides , difficulties clinical diagnosis , lack effectiveness treatment much evidence find regard invasive physical therapy technique population . Purpose : To determine efficacy single physical therapy intervention deep dry needle latent active myofascial trigger point old adult non-specific shoulder pain . Methods : Pilot Study , Single Blind Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial 60 subject age 65 , diagnose nonspecific shoulder pain . The study approve Clinical Research Ethics Committee area . Sample recruit home care center , randomly distribute Experimental Group ( n=30 ) , receive session Deep Dry Needling active latent Myofascial Trigger Points infraspinatus muscle ; Control Group ( n=30 ) , receive session Deep Dry Needling active Myofascial Trigger Point . A blind examiner evaluate Pain Intensity , Pain Pressure Threshold ( anterior deltoid ; extensor carpi radialis brevis ) Grip Strength , , immediately intervention week treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Dry Needling Myofascial Trigger Points Older Adults With Nonspecific Shoulder Pain
